poem:
Title: "In the Halls of Power, A Cry Rings"

In Whitehall's rooted stronghold,
a breech, ripped open by Tory hands,
an echo, replayed on X's digital sands.
Oh, Davies, player in the unforgotten game,
each tweet a claim of your embittered fame.
Labour calls it unjust—infringement pure.
But politicians change as swift as April's demure-
a dance of power, lasting but a fleeting lure.
